title: French frigate Marocain
text:
Marocain, was a <a href="frigate">frigate</a> in the <a href="Free%20French%20Naval%20Forces">Free French Naval Forces</a> during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> and the <a href="French%20Navy">French Navy</a> post-war. The ship was originally built as USS "Marocain" (DE-109), an American .
History.
World War II.
During <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, "Marocain" was transferred to the <a href="Free%20French%20Naval%20Forces">Free French Naval Forces</a> under <a href="lend%20lease">lend lease</a> on 29 February 1944, and retained the name "Marocain".
"Marocain" participated in <a href="Operation%20Anvil-Dragoon">Operation Anvil-Dragoon</a> on 15 August 1944.
Ownership of the vessel was transferred to France on 21 April 1952 under the <a href="Mutual%20Defense%20Assistance%20Program">Mutual Defense Assistance Program</a>.
